posts.title: Introducing Flipster: Free Access to More Than 100 Popular Magazines
posts.text: The New York Public Library now offers free access to Flipster, a digital magazine platform that allows users to read more than 100 popular titles.

posts.title: Explore Updates to NYPL's Website
posts.text: Beginning today, the Library is introducing a new home page and other website changes that intend to make it easier for our online users to find what they are looking for while also helping them to discover our collections, programs, services, and locations.

posts.title: Updates to NYPL's Website
posts.text: We are preparing  to make updates to our website, particularly to our home page and other key pages, that are designed to make it easier for our online users to find what they are looking for while also helping them to discover our collections, programs, services, and locations.

posts.title: Introducing SimplyE: 300,000 E-Books to Browse, Borrow, and Read
posts.text: The New York Public Library just released SimplyE, a new app that gives NYPL cardholders the ability to browse, borrow, and read more than 300,000 e-books from the Library’s collections in just a few easy steps.

posts.title: Celebrating Diverse Children's Books: These Stories Dazzle and Reflect
posts.text: A list drawing on the work of children's librarians Jeanne Lamb, Elizabeth Bird, and many of their colleagues, who are at the forefront of promoting diverse titles to readers in New York City and beyond, year after year, through NYPL's 100 Titles for Reading and Sharing.
